block.p: Kelly O'Connell Bird, the daughter of Julie Bird of Brooklyn and the late David Bird, was married on Friday to Jacques Steven Pierre, the son of Famicide Pierre of Brooklyn and the late Jacques Pierre. The Rev. Dr. Paul Smith, a Presbyterian minister, officiated at Manhattan Penthouse.
Mr. and Mrs. Pierre, both 26, graduated from Wesleyan University, where they met.

Kelly O'Connell Bird, the daughter of Julie Bird of Brooklyn and the late David Bird, was married on Friday to Jacques Steven Pierre, the son of Famicide Pierre of Brooklyn and the late Jacques Pierre. The Rev. Dr. Paul Smith, a Presbyterian minister, officiated at Manhattan Penthouse.
Mr. and Mrs. Pierre, both 26, graduated from Wesleyan University, where they met.

The bride teaches third grade at the Little Red School House in Manhattan. She received a master's degree in elementary education from the Bank Street College of Education. Her father was a reporter for The New York Times. Her mother owns Perin & Bird Interiors, a design business in Brooklyn.

The bridegroom was a high school history teacher at the Friends Academy in Locust Valley, N.Y., until earlier this month. In July, he will join the Teak Fellowship in Manhattan, counseling high school students; the program helps junior high school students apply to and study at top public and private schools. His mother is a laboratory assistant in physiology at the Columbia University College of Physicians and Surgeons in Manhattan. His father owned M.G.P. Enterprise, an auto repair shop that was in Brooklyn.
